com.kremerk.commandprocessor
Interface CommandSet

public interface CommandSet

A command set is a set of commands that will be run on a server.

The way this works is you make your class that implements CommandSet. The only resonse this exists is for a little bit of type safety. This will work in tandem with the CommandProcessorImpl which will actually run the command.

the class name of the class that implements the CommandSet will be the name of the CommandSet. Each method inside the class that implements can be a command. The method name will be the command name. Using reflection the CommandProcessorImpl will get the CommandSet that is registered to it and will run the command function and return the data from it. The expected return type of the methods in the CommandSet is Object The request to the CommandSevlet needs to have a type parameter passed to it which will deferment what it will cast the value from the CommandSet to.

For a type of "json" or ResponseType.JSON, it will cast the result to a JSONArray

For a type of "binary" or ResponseType.BINARY, it will cast the result to a byte[]

Future response types could be supported, such as XML.

Author:
Nick
